|Title=Knowing the risk of excess mortality in untreated gout
|Description=U-shaped curve
|Heading=Monitoring and/or prognosis
|Contributors=
|Order=16}}
- Gout must be treated in view of its associated cardiovascular mortality.

- However, hypouricaemia also carries a risk of increased mortality.

properties.question: What is the relationship between untreated gout and mortality risk, according to the U-shaped curve concept?
properties.option_a: Treating gout has no impact on cardiovascular mortality risk.
properties.option_b: Untreated gout is associated with decreased mortality risk at all levels of uric acid.
properties.option_c: Untreated gout is associated with increased mortality risk, especially at the extremes of uric acid levels.
properties.option_d: Lower uric acid levels due to hypouricaemia always decrease mortality risk.
